ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this class to my fellow students.

CMP 570 is an introduction to the mammalian primary senses. The lectures are about 3-5 per sensory system. I would highly recommend this class because of the opportunity to listen to researchers talk about their respective fields.

I would summarize the class as a seminar-style walk through several sensory systems and exploration of functional principles common through out. I would recommend the class to another student because the lecturers and topics were well chosen and the discussion lively.
I would definitely recommend this course. Complex issues were well presented.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course helped deepen my knowledge of my discipline. It provided an overview of my area of research.
This course helped give me a deeper understanding of similarities and dissimilarities between sensory systems. As a student, this wider perspective will help guide future research directions.

A foundation of study of sensory systems is beneficial to my development as a neuroscientist, because it provides breadth of knowledge useful for understanding basic operating principles of the nervous system. Some of lectures provided information relevant to my dissertation research, such as Len Kaczmareks explanation of potassium channels in the auditory system.
I have learned a lot about the visual sensory system in conjunction with myinterests in neurology.
